original_title: Sri Lanka, India sign MoUs on renewable energy cooperation
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka and India have entered memoranda of understanding (MoU) on renewable energy cooperation, an energy hub development in Trincomalee, Power & Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara said.

The minister tweeted Saturday July 22 morning that a Sri Lankan delegation to India led by President Ranil Wickremesinghe has discussed energy cooperation policy plans and investments in the bilateral discussions that was held in New Delhi, to boost the economic and energy partnerships between the two countries.

“MOUs on Renewable Energy Cooperation, Trincomalee Energy hub development was entered into during the visit & the Energy permit for the Sampur Solar park was issued for the joint venture between CEB & NTPC of India to commence work,” the minister tweeted.
At a meeting held with Indian business tycoon Gautham Adani, a commitment was given to complete work on the 500 MW Solar and Wind project in Mannar and Pooneryn by January 2025, he said.

“India-SL grid connectivity, Green Hydrogen, Oil pipeline connectivity & energy sector investments was discussed during the discussions held with HE Prime Minister Narendra Modi, HE President Droupadi Murm, Senior Govt Officials & Investors,” he said. (Colombo/Jul22/2023)
